title: PSA about how reports actually work. Salty lowbies, please read.
body:
I am going to clarify a few misconceptions a large majority of players seem to have about the report system:

**More reports mean a higher chance of punishment**
   One and only one report is needed to flag an automatic review of the game and account. This is why asking other people to report someone does no good and is considered punishable harassment.

**People can get punished just for being reported**
Incorrect. If a report is filed and the review finds no misconduct, the false report actually counts against the reputation of the reporter.

**Reports do not work! Rito pls.**
Yes, they do. If you report people who actually did something wrong (puncturing your paper-thin skin is not automatically punishable, neither is picking a champion you dont like), you will often get a little popup box saying that someone you reported has been reviewed and punished. Typically it takes more than one reviewed and guilty game to trigger punishment.

**Things people, mainly angry kids, think are punishable, which are actually not:**
**A:** "Troll" and "Nonmeta" picks are completely OK, unless they lead to reportable behavior, like feeding. Most often they do not, unless the team is set on throwing the game as hard as possible by flaming or refusing to help the "troll" pick.
**B: **Not ganking your (0/6 at 12 minute) top lane: Totally OK. No good jungler would, anyway.
**C: **Refusing to join your curse chat or skype. Nobody wants to hear squeaky voices with awful feedback loops.

replies.body:
This post is BS like the report and "reform" system, and the reason is that only behavior that can be detected by the automated system gets punished. What is the point on reporting an afk if he gets LeaverBustered anyways? 

The only truth here is the just one report for triggering verbal abuse review (by a machine). But if you troll it doesn't matter if you get one or one hundred reports, if you don't afk and never say a word in chat you will NEVER get punished. This is because there are no actual people reviewing this reports (except extreme cases like cheating, fraud or notoriously public cases) and an automated system can't detect a troll.

"If a report is filed and the review finds no misconduct, the false report actually counts against the reputation of the reporter." This is ridiculous per se but even more when you are aware of the previous fact.  Not that it  really matters if your "reporting privilege" gets revoked, the only times your reports counted were auto detected by the system anyways.

No one reports for troll picks, not ganking or refusing to join skype.

Things we DO report that go against the rules but will never be punished:
- "asking other people to report someone"
- "gg ez" and all its variations
- Banning your pick intent on purpose because it was considered a "troll pick"
- Spamming pings, emotes, masteries.
- Flooding the post game chat (you can do anything there really, except extreme harassment that could be screenshoted, it's not monitored).
- Any trolling ingame behavior except going afk or suiciding straight to turret. And I mean ANY, Riot will never punish you for things like following your jungler all game and taking his farm for no reason, building 6 tear of the goddess, engaging 1vs5 repeatedly or eating your ADC with tahm kench and tossing him under the opponent turret because as they have stated many times they won't enforce the meta.

Learn this, only chat toxicity and abuse is getting punished. The only thing riot cares about are flamers/ragers, the trolls have the right to troll because you will never prove that they were trolling on purpose, so if you try to argue with them YOU are the one getting banned.

You don't like flamers, you can mute them, the flame disappears instantly. I don't like trolls/feeders, what can I do? Report them? Even if it worked (spoiler: it does not) that would not prevent them from ruining this one game.

I really don't get the Riot fanboys trying to justify this system when it's clear after playing just 5 minutes of this game that it doesn't work as intended.

There have been manual reviews and punishments doled out. 

Plenty of people report for petty shit, including "troll picks" and "not ganking". 

People have been banned for all of these things. Post game chat is accessible and you can either take a screenshot and send to support or specify in your report toxcity was in post chat, which then is noted. 

Lots of people get banned, but those things are harder to catch and therefore require attention of support, who is swamped by all those requests.
Do you have any proof that someone has been banned for something not chat or AFK related?
Just take a look at this board if you want some answers. People crying about getting banned for int feed or other things and then come to cry about it.
I took several looks and cannot find a single one that didn't include some form of verbal abuse/harassment. If you have better luck than me please show me the post.

Well let's see
Here are three that mention/has a person punished for stuff other then verbal harassment:
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/3ZYARAc6-i-just-want-to-give-a-big-shout-out-to-riot-for-doing-an-amazing-job
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/M9AEn64U-i-believe-my-temp-ban-was-unjustified-and-heres-why
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/yFiRsBXp-i-just-got-banned-for-int-feeding-but-i-was-actually-just-having-a-really-bad-game
Say what you like about how "deserved" the punishment was, but still was a punishment for something other then verbal abuse.

Here's a discussion on int feeding and banning, with statement from a red and someone who admitted to getting banned for int feeding:
http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/bQ8hJ0kJ-will-i-get-banned-for-intentional-feeding

There. Apparently I had better luck, or maybe I tried harder, idk.

The first one shows no proof. The second one looks good at first but when you keep reading the post he shows some images of chat toxicity, at least for Riot standards ("idgaf I will report everbody", "tp, I told you to tp", and spamming "open mid"). 

In the third one, if you read my original post I said: "Any trolling ingame behavior EXCEPT going afk or *suiciding straight to turret*". Several players in the comment section reviewed his game and it seems that is exactly what he did.

This reinforces what I'm trying to say, only actions that the automated system can detect are punished. IMO the statements of the "red" in your fourth link are related to this, they will never admit it but all his comments make you think that he is talking about the parameters of the system.

In the same fourth link we have this one admitting his friend got banned (again with no proof), but no need because he admits too that he was toxic ingame ("He has a really odd sarcastic sense of humor that isn't conveyed well in all chat, so the fact he wasn't banned before this for another offense is amazing to me") and going straight to suicide with karthus and yasuo, the same behavior that the riven from the third one.

Still not convinced, sorry for wasting your time.

The first one is a nunu being banned for trolling the jungle.

Second shows that despite being toxic the reason for his ban was the fact that they thought he didn't play the role he picked.

In the third people did not say he just went straight under turret every time they said he only died in his own lane all game, which is suspicious and griefing behavior.

The second one shows that it was done by manual review, so support does give out bans, but think about how many they can review and bans they can give out vs the population of the player base, anything larger scale would be too hard on them.

The forth link has a red saying something, which apparently you won't believe, but it's not even a matter of the guy's friend, there are people who admitted to trolling and getting banned. 

So I guess proof for you would be actually seeing a support swinging the ban hammer on someone, which is one of the many things I can't provide anyone.

Generally speaking, it takes repeated calls for reports and is usually accompanied by other minor harassment (or major harassment) to be punished. 

I'm willing to bet money that most players are willing to overlook the first report call or two in a vacuum. Less so for the subsequent report calls and other harassment. Or the player who tells other people that they are "muted and reported" multiple times per person in a single game.
Repent, disbeliever.
Informative content, this post should be sticky for all to see!
I reported a booster today. He's still boosting.

An indication that the reporting/verification of boosters takes longer than a day, but not particularly helpful beyond that. We know from past seasons boosting results in losing season rewards, and the wave usually comes out near the end of the season.

In my opinion the report system needs some improvement. Like Riot should do a manual review of a players games before dishing out big punishments like 14 day bans etc. I recently was 14 day banned for int feeding even though I was just having a really really bad game.
Takes WAY more than one bad game to get an intentionally feeding ban.
Also do you know how many reports they get? Support is swamped as it is. They don't have the time to manually go through reports to figure out how deserved the ban is.

not exactly true.  if you report people a lot your 'report weight' is lowered and your report may not be enough to trigger a review.  therefore if more people report someone there is a higher chance someone with a stronger report weight will get the offender punished.

i hadnt gotten a 'the player you reported has been punished' for months.  then i made a new account and got the message 3 times within the first two weeks.

There's some speculation that the system cracks down harder on new accounts, assuming they're smurfs/previously banned players who should know how to behave and don't need as many warnings before being escalated. Assuming you're reporting the same behavior, then that *should* be the deciding factor rather than your report weight.
could be right.  i have heard riot talk about report weight before though.
I've found when it comes to reports, it's better to literally never talk in this game because anytime you do, if you even slightly disagree with someone you will get reported by them.
